contents.heading: Introduction to Golang
contents.body: Go, also known as Golang, is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed at Google. It is known for its simplicity, efficiency, and strong support for concurrent programming.

contents.heading: Generics in Go
contents.body: Go introduced generics in version 1.18, allowing developers to write more flexible and reusable code. Generics enable writing functions and data structures that can work with any data type.

contents.heading: What is NATS?
contents.body: NATS is a simple, high-performance open-source messaging system for cloud-native applications, IoT, and microservices architectures. It provides a lightweight and efficient way for services to communicate.

contents.heading: HashiCorp Nomad
contents.body: Nomad is a simple and flexible workload orchestrator to deploy and manage containers and non-containerized applications across on-prem and clouds at scale. It is an alternative to Kubernetes.

contents.heading: Kubernetes Basics
contents.body: Kubernetes, also known as K8s, is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. It has become the de-facto standard for container orchestration.
